Description: Lower half of terracotta figure of Aphrodite. The lower part of a figure of Aphrodite, probably Anadyomene: modelled in the round, but broken away at waist level. A himation is draped round the hips, with a simple hitch just above the pubic area, and falling to her feet. The right leg takes her weight, the left leg is slightly bent. Summary treatment of the drapery at the back. Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt, with minute traces of a white dressing.
Curator's comments: BMM Terracotta IV Comparandum. Near: Breccia 1934: no. 2, from the Fayum. Bibliog. Petrie 1905: pl. xlv:6; Nachtergael 1985: 233.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3350)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
